intro: Symplocos trichoclada, commonly known as the hairy wax myrtle, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. Symplocos trichoclada thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
